body_html:
Packing RNN arguments in a tuple is easy, e.g. replacing this
https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/word_language_model/model.py#L26
with

def forward(self, inptuple):
    input = inptuple[0]
    hidden = inptuple[1] #possibly a nested tuple

but if you wrap thus defined module in DataParallel, it will run fine on multi-GPU and will error out on a single GPU.

body:
Packing RNN arguments in a tuple is easy, e.g. replacing this
https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/word_language_model/model.py#L26
with
```
def forward(self, inptuple):
    input = inptuple[0]
    hidden = inptuple[1] #possibly a nested tuple
```
but if you wrap thus defined module in DataParallel, it will run fine on multi-GPU and will error out on a single GPU.
